alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 3:00PM PST until February 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, the higher terrain of Modoc County, including the Warner Mountains. For the seconds Winter Weather Advisory, all of Modoc County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
